Posts.Title: What's the Dumbest Thing a Medical Professional Has Said to You 4myangels Tweetyb422

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 02:23AM M-Aug wrote: My PCP put me on birth control to shrink my " abcess". Ugh it made me want to scream when I was diagnosed. I switched doctors but I still have all my scan results sent to him. Makes me feel better knowing this will follow him.

Posts.Title: Gemzar is working!!! LuvRVing Heidihill

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 02:47AM M-Aug wrote: Hi, If it makes you feel better and it should, I have mets everywhere. I am not kidding lung, liver,bones, skin and two spots in my brain. Yikes, 2 years ago I would never had thought that was possible. If you asked anyone at my kids school they would really have no idea, other then the scarves. All that to say my doc, who is one of the best in so cal never has given me a time frame. He talks about hope and thank God because I need to hear it sometimes. My mets are numerous and diffuse but he always talks about our plan of action and what's in the pipeline for new cancer treatments. I had a similar argument with my husband and I realized I have to surround my three kiddos with loving friends and family so if anything should happen they will find love and support there. I also started journals that just document the joys of everyday life together. Best of luck to you. There is so much to be hopeful about!

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2012 05:59PM M-Aug wrote: Just to make it more confusing I had a PET scan in sep during chemotherapy when my TM were 96 and it was clean the radiologist actually used the words great. Lung Dr that I saw last week said noduals are either cancer, fungus or TB. I flatlined my white blood cells during first chemotherapy and ended up in the er for 24 hours and then three days on the oncology floor two rooms down from some one with active TB. Who knows what I could have picked up. Maybe a visit with another lung Dr is in order.

Posts.Title: Liver mets sypmtoms Evans1128 soleil505

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 09:42AM M-Aug wrote: There are a lot of treatment options out there. That is not to say I didn't cry, I sobbed. I felt like this should be all behind me now. I have three young ones and I didn't want this for them. Of course I get rattled sometimes but I came to the realization that I can do my best trying to keep things "normal" for them. They are truly happiest just hanging out with me at home. Life is different then I hoped but I had to tell them it is what it is and we will get through it as a family. And we tell lots of jokes. I think kids look to us as guides. You are strong and tough. Look to us for help and guidance and you will feel stronger soon.
